intro: Ocimum peulhorum, commonly known as the African basil, is a perennial herb native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a strong, spicy fragrance. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or white, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the branches. Ocimum peulhorum is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine to treat various ailments.
